alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Stanton (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 7:25PM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Hamilton, northwestern Kearny and north central Stanton Counties through 815 PM CDT/715 PM MDT/... At 725 PM CDT/625 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles south of Coolidge, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. Widespread heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Syracuse. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT/900 PM MDT/ for southwestern Kansas.
